page.title: 01Summary of Area.
page.content: This area is part of {England's {'Invasion Coastline',}and reminders of threatened invasions{-Camber Castle, {the Martello Tower}at Rye Harbour - remain in the landscape today. The land is flat,good grazing ground,and the fields around Camber Castle are dotted with sheep. From{Rye Bay}there are spectacular views to Dungeness and west to Winchelsea and the hills of Fairlight.From the approach to Rye Harbour Village,where there is much industrial development,striking views of ancient Rye on the hill may be seen. There is an area of great interest to bird watchers and naturalists,as the land west of the Rother has been designated{Rye Harbour Nature Reserve. A walk from Rye Harbour to Winchelsea Beach may be taken across the reserve.
